definitions: a building that people, usually one family, live in
all the people living in a house
a building where animals are kept
a building or part of a building that is used for a special purpose
a company that is involved in a particular area of business
a restaurant, especially one selling a particular type of food
used before another noun to refer to something that is always or often served in a particular restaurant and is good there, such as a wine that is reasonably priced or a dish that is especially good
a hospital; used especially before another noun to refer to doctors working in a hospital who are still training
popular dance music with a fast regular beat, usually produced on electronic equipment
any of a small number of groups that the children in a school are put in for sports and other competitions
an important family, especially a royal one
an organization that makes laws, or its meeting place
the members of the organization that makes laws
the group of people who suggest a subject for a debate
the people watching a performance, especially in a theatre
to give a person or animal a place to live, or to provide space for something
examples: a detached/semi-detached house
to buy/rent a house
house prices
She lives in a little house in (US on) Cross Street.
the whole house Try not to wake the whole house when you come in!
the monkey/lion house at the zoo
a hen house
the Sydney Opera House
Broadcasting House
a publishing house
a fashion house
Roast chicken is a speciality of the house.
a waffle/steak/sushi house
a curry house (= a South Asian restaurant)
house wine To keep costs down, ask for "vino de la casa", or house wine.
house white I'll have a glass of the house white, please.
house red We split a carafe of house red.
Our house cocktail is an Indian twist on the classic gin and tonic.
The pies are a house speciality.
house staff House staff includes residents, interns, and medical students, who are at various stages of training and who are supervised by the attending physician.
A house officer is a resident physician of a hospital (the "house") who is receiving further training.
House music first appeared in the late 1980s.
an inter-house hockey match
The British Royal Family belong to the House of Windsor.
The House began debating the proposal at 3 p.m.
The motion for tonight's debate is, "This house believes that capital punishment should be abolished."
full house The opera played to a full house.
packed house Everyone in the packed house rose to their feet and applauded.
It will be difficult to house all the refugees.
The museum houses the biggest collection of antique toys in Europe.
